intro: Niphobolus distichocarpus, commonly known as the two-fruited niphobolus, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruits are two-lobed capsules that contain small, hard seeds. Niphobolus distichocarpus is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain.
